page.title: 01Shenley & Whaddon Area
page.content: Shenley and Whaddon are 2 villages in North Buckinghamshire. Shenley Church End & Shenley Brook End are still two quiet communities within the fast- growing city of Milton Keynes. Plans for their development are viewed with mixed feelings by the local inhabitants. Whaddon is however outside the city's designated area. The landscape is largely one of farm and woodland with some good local walks including one which takes the walker along an old Drovers' Way. There are several privately owned moated sites, some unexcavated earth- works, 2 19th C village schools, two attractive churches & 2 public houses. The population here is of mixed ages & interests.The majority of people are home owners & have employment locally although a significant minority commute to London & Northampton.
